title: Oxfordshire Live: Wednesday 14 December - BBC News
summary: hour-long delays after earlier crash on a34 northbound .
banbury councillor apologises for not supporting syrian military intervention .
oxfordshire pilot warns people off buying drones for christmas .
song by world war one composer discovered in bodleian .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: local live for oxfordshire returns tomorrow at 08:00 .
we hope to see you then .

documents.title: oxford 's loos among the best in the land
text: the results of the british toilet association 's loo of the year awards are in , and oxford has come out smelling of roses .
there was nothing bog standard about oxford city council 's results at the ceremony , with 18 wins , as well as coming top in the the public toilet category .
the authority has spent £ 700,000 on refurbishment work on its facilities .

john tanner , board member for a clean and green oxford , said : `` it 's a remarkable achievement and recognition of the investment the city council has made to ensure the facilities are first-rate .
`` these awards are a well-deserved acknowledgement for the council staff who keep our public conveniences clean . ''

documents.title: oxfordshire 's chief fire officer retires after 32 years
text: oxfordshire 's chief fire officer dave etheridge obe has announced his retirement after 32 years .
he is also president of the chief fire officers association and will retire from both roles on 31 march 2017 .
he said : it has been my privilege to serve in oxfordshire my entire career .
i can honestly put my hand on my heart and say that i have thoroughly enjoyed the last 32 years . ''
deputy chief fire officer simon furlong has been selected to become the next chief fire officer .
he will formally take up the post from 1 april 2017 .

documents.title: weather : 'long clear spells '
text: it will stay dry tonight and there will be long , clear spells at first , ideal for viewing the super moon and perhaps even the geminids meteor shower if you stare at the sky for long enough .
however , thick cloud will roll over us late in the night bringing mist and fog over the cotswolds and blotting out the view of the stars .
minimum temperature : 5c ( 41f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel update : slow on a34 northbound at kidlington
text: there 's slow traffic on the a34 northbound in kidlington between kidlington junction and the islip turn off .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: details of new abingdon pool released
text: vale of white horse district council is to replace abingdon 's abbey meadow outdoor pool with a brand new pool in 2017 .
the new pool will include a shallow beach area allowing easy access to the water , and a deep water area for more experienced swimmers and diving .
the plans will also see the pool changing rooms and toilets refurbished , and some structural renovations .

in november the council revealed plans for a new £ 320,000 play area to be open by easter 2017 and , earlier this week , confirmed £ 230,000 plans for new public toilets , changing facilities and an accessible path which will be in place by next summer .

documents.title: willie j healey performs acoustic song
text: willie j healey was a guest on this week 's bbc introducing in oxford show .
willie , from carterton , who has been touring throughout 2016 after being signed to columbia , played an unreleased song in the studio called we should hang .
watch his performance in this video for which he was awarded a biscuit .

documents.title: the rocky horror radio show
text: georgia may foote ( here , a jump to the left ) and norman pace ( a step to the right ) , who are starring in the rocky horror picture show at the new theatre , popped in to see kat orman this morning .
@ georgiafoote and norman pace have headed back to @ twitterid ( on georgia may foote street ) after chatting to @ twitterid on @ twitterid

text: gender pronoun leaflet claim rubbished

documents.title: watch : diagnosing parkinsons
text: parkinsons uk needs healthy men in oxfordshire to come forward and be part of a research study to help them find simple ways to diagnose and monitor the disease much more accurately .
radio oxford 's david prever and sophie law were joined this morning by dr tom barber , a research fellow at oxford parkinsons disease centre .
he tried some of the tests on david live on air .
watch it back and see how he did .

documents.title: brochure selling benefits of oxfordshire could help solve teaching crisis
text: a brochure touting the delights of living in oxfordshire could be used to help solve a chronic shortage of teachers .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: oxford united through after 3-0 fa cup win
text: oxford united are through to the third round of the fa cup after a 3-0 win over macclesfield in last night 's second round replay at the kassam stadium .
the goal scorers were ryan taylor ( joe rothwell and kane hemmings .
macclesfield were already a goal down when they had a man sent off .
a negative for oxford is defender aaron martin is likely to miss the rest of the season after being stretchered off just a few seconds into the match .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: hundreds attend funeral for ex-mayor
text: hundreds attend funeral for ex-mayor

documents.title: travel update : queues at wolvercote
text: there 's delays on the a40 in both directions in oxford at the wolvercote roundabout , with congestion to the cassington junction .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: santa trades in the reindeer for a chopper
text: santa made a flying visit to oxfordshire yesterday in a military puma helicopter from raf benson .
he visited oxford 's john radcliffe hospital to give presents donated by military personnel to sick children .

documents.title: bucket list student dies of cancer
text: bucket list student dies of cancer

documents.title: cameron looks a right donkey on his christmas card
text: before you complain to ofcom that this is a prime example of the bbc 's left-wing bias , the former pm is also in on the joke .

mr cameron - who left front line politics after the british people voted to leave the eu - commissioned telegraph cartoonist matt pritchett to draw the card , which de the former pm and his wife samantha playing a pantomime donkey .
the caption says : `` it 's an exciting new challenge for david and samantha cameron . ''
author: Alex Regan
BBC South

documents.title: oxfordshire pilot warns of drone dangers before christmas
text: people need to make sure they 're aware of the dangers of flying drones before buying one at christmas , according to pilots in oxfordshire .
the civil aviation authority suggests only 36 % of buyers get drone safety guidance .

managing director of oxfordshire-based aerial motion pictures matt williams said : `` for people who class these aircraft as toys , the is the potential that if it was to hit an aircraft in the wrong place at the wrong time it could cause a serious drama . ''

documents.title: lost christmas song found after 100 years
text: a christmas song which has been lost for a century has been discovered in time for the festive season .
the song was written by george butterworth , a `` promising composer '' who died in world war one .

documents.title: banbury councillor apologises for `` not supporting syrian intervention ''
text: a labour councillor has apologised for not backing proposals for military intervention in syria in 2013 .

sean woodcock , who was a parliamentary candidate in banbury in the 2015 election , said that he made the decision not to back the coalition government 's proposals to attack president assad 's forces because of his `` memories of iraq '' .

he said : `` while the action proposed on 2013 was flawed and perilous , it turns out that not acting is worse.. by not acting , we gave a green light for all of the war crimes we have witnessed since . ''
it comes after claims by the un that civilians have been killed in the most recent battles in aleppo by pro-government forces .

BBC Oxford travel presenter

documents.title: oxford weather : cloud with bright spells
text: most of us are going to start the day with a bit of cloud , but that should clear and a lot of us will enjoy some bright spells .
it 's relatively mild with temperatures hitting about 13c , tonight will be a fresher day than yesterday with temperatures of 6c .

documents.title: do that wednesday boogie
text: good morning one and all and welcome to today 's oxfordshire live page .
i 'm sure i do n't need to tell you how this works , but for posterity i will do just that .
we 'll be providing news , sports , travel and weather from across the shire until 18.00 and after that i go home and sit in silence , waiting for the sun to rise .
do n't forget to send us your snaps for this week 's oxfordshire 's big picture .
above is another brilliant of great haseley windmill by the man , the legend , that is anthony morris .
you can send us your snaps by email .
author: Alex Regan
BBC South
